2G1.1.title: Promoting a Commercial Sex Act or Prohibited Sexual Conduct with an

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense of conviction 18 U.S.C. § 1591 (sex trafficking of children or by force, fraud, or coercion)?

noResult.description: No base offense level specified for other offenses under this guideline

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does the offense involve fraud or coercion, or is the offense of conviction 18 U.S.C. § 2421A(b)(2)?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved fraud or coercion, or offense of conviction is 18 U.S.C. § 2421A(b)(2)

2G1.3.title: Promoting a Commercial Sex Act or Prohibited Sexual Conduct with a Minor;

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1591?

noResult.description: Not convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1591 - no base offense level applies from this section

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant a parent, relative, or legal guardian of the minor, or was the minor otherwise in the custody, care, or supervisory control of the defendant?

yesEffect.description: Defendant was parent/guardian or had custody/care/supervisory control

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve knowing misrepresentation of identity to persuade/induce/entice/coerce travel by minor, or did a participant otherwise unduly influence a minor to engage in prohibited sexual conduct?
Did the offense involve use of a computer or interactive computer service to persuade/induce/entice/coerce travel by minor or to entice/encourage/offer/solicit prohibited sexual conduct?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Subsection (b)(3)(B) does not apply if offense of conviction is 18 U.S.C. § 2421A

yesEffect.description: Computer or interactive computer service used

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Apply the greater enhancement for sexual conduct or commercial sex act involvement:

options.label: No enhancement applies
Offense involved sex act/sexual contact, OR subsection (a)(3)/(a)(4) applies and involved commercial sex act
Subsection (a)(4) applies AND offense of conviction is 18 U.S.C. § 2421A(b)(2)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve a minor who had not attained the age of 12 years?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if subsection (a)(3) or (a)(4) applies

2G2.1.title: Sexually Exploiting a Minor by Production of Sexually Explicit Visual or

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this case involve an offense under §2G2.1?

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the age of the minor involved in the offense?

options.label: 16 years or older
12-15 years old
Under 12 years old

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What type of sexual conduct was involved in the offense?

options.label: No sexual act or sexual contact
Sexual act or sexual contact
Sexual act AND conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 2241(a) or (b)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant knowingly engage in distribution?
Did the offense involve material that portrays sadistic or masochistic conduct, other depictions of violence, or an infant or toddler?

yesEffect.description: Material portrayed sadistic/masochistic conduct, violence, or infant/toddler

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant a parent, relative, or legal guardian of the minor, or was the minor otherwise in the defendant's custody, care, or supervisory control?

yesEffect.description: Defendant was in position of trust or authority over the minor

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve knowing misrepresentation of identity or use of computer/internet to solicit or facilitate the minor's participation?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: For the purpose of producing sexually explicit material or transmitting such material live

yesEffect.description: Used misrepresentation or computer/internet to solicit minor participation

2G2.2.title: Trafficking in Material Involving the Sexual Exploitation of a Minor; Receiving,

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1466A(b), § 2252(a)(4), § 2252A(a)(5), or § 2252A(a)(7)?

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does the defendant qualify for the limited receipt/solicitation reduction?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if: (A) subsection (a)(2) applies; (B) defendant's conduct was limited to receipt or solicitation of material; and (C) defendant did not intend to traffic in or distribute such material

yesEffect.description: Limited to receipt/solicitation without intent to distribute

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the material involve a prepubescent minor or a minor who had not attained the age of 12 years?

yesEffect.description: Material involved prepubescent minor or minor under 12

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What type of distribution was involved (if any)?

options.label: No distribution
Distribution for pecuniary gain
options.description: Based on retail value but not less than 5 levels

options.label: Distribution in exchange for valuable consideration (not pecuniary gain)
Distribution to a minor
Distribution to minor intended to persuade illegal activity (not sexual conduct)
Distribution to minor intended to facilitate prohibited sexual conduct
Other knowing distribution

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the material portray sadistic/masochistic conduct, violence, or sexual abuse of infant/toddler?

yesEffect.description: Material portrayed sadistic/masochistic conduct, violence, or abuse of infant/toddler

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant engage in a pattern of activity involving sexual abuse or exploitation of a minor?

yesEffect.description: Pattern of activity involving sexual abuse or exploitation of minor

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve use of a computer or interactive computer service?

yesEffect.description: Used computer or interactive computer service for possession, transmission, receipt, distribution, or accessing material

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: How many images were involved in the offense?

options.label: Fewer than 10 images
At least 10 but fewer than 150 images
At least 150 but fewer than 300 images
At least 300 but fewer than 600 images
600 or more images

2G3.1.title: Importing, Mailing, or Transporting Obscene Matter; Transferring Obscene

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What type of distribution was involved? (Apply the Greatest)

options.label: No distribution or none of the below apply
Distribution for pecuniary gain (increase by levels from §2B1.1 table corresponding to retail value, but not less than 5 levels)
options.description: Minimum 5 levels, but may be higher based on retail value per §2B1.1

options.label: Distribution in exchange for valuable consideration, but not for pecuniary gain
Distribution to a minor
Distribution to a minor intended to persuade, induce, entice, or coerce minor to engage in illegal activity (other than prohibited sexual conduct)
Distribution to a minor intended to persuade, induce, entice, coerce, or facilitate travel to engage in prohibited sexual conduct
Knowingly engaged in distribution (other than above types)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve using misleading domain names or embedded words/images to deceive a minor into viewing harmful material?

yesEffect.description: Use of misleading domain name or embedded words/digital images with intent to deceive minor

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the use of a computer or an interactive computer service?

yesEffect.description: Use of computer or interactive computer service

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve material that portrays sadistic or masochistic conduct or other depictions of violence?

yesEffect.description: Material portraying sadistic/masochistic conduct or violence

2G3.2.title: Obscene Telephone Communications for a Commercial Purpose;

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does 6 plus the offense level from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to the volume of commerce attributable to the defendant result in a level greater than 16 (base level 12 plus maximum 4-level enhancement)?

yesResult.description: Large-scale operation enhancement applies - use 6 plus the offense level from §2B1.1 table based on volume of commerce

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was a person who received the telephonic communication less than eighteen years of age, OR was a broadcast made between six o'clock in the morning and eleven o'clock at night?

yesResult.description: Base level 12, plus 4 levels for communication received by minor or broadcast during daytime hours

noResult.description: Base offense level with no enhancements

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did a person who received the telephonic communication under 18 years of age, or was a broadcast made between 6:00 AM and 11:00 PM?

yesEffect.description: Communication received by minor or broadcast during daytime hours

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does 6 plus the offense level from §2B1.1 corresponding to the volume of commerce attributable to the defendant exceed the offense level determined above?

yesEffect.description: Large-scale operation based on volume of commerce
